intro: Tephroseris caucasigena, commonly known as the Caucasian tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Tephroseris caucasigena is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
